algorithm_technique: Check if the largest power of 3 within integer limits divides n.
Use logarithms to check if log base 3 of n is an integer.
problem_summary_simple: Determine if an integer can be expressed as 3 raised to some integer power.
problem_summary_technical: Check if n is positive and if the maximum power of 3 divides n, or if log3(n) is an integer.
key_insights: The largest power of 3 that fits within a 32-bit signed integer is 3^19.
Any power of 3 must be a divisor of the largest power of 3 within the integer range.
Logarithm properties can be used to check for powers.
Floating-point precision issues might arise, so `is_integer()` is crucial.
